fullProgramDescription: The Music Industry program at UCLA's Herb Alpert School of Music prepares students for careers in the music industry by providing a comprehensive education in music business, production, and technology. The program covers the music industry's commercial and artistic aspects, including recording, publishing, marketing, and management. Students gain hands-on experience through internships, projects, and collaborative work.
shortProgramDescription: The Music Industry B.A. program at UCLA educates students in the business, production, and technology of the music industry, preparing them for diverse careers.
classHighlights: The curriculum includes foundational courses such as Introduction to the Music Industry, Music Business Law, and Music Production Techniques.
Students explore the commercial aspects of the music industry through courses like Music Marketing, Music Publishing, and Artist Management.
The program emphasizes the development of skills in music production, recording technology, and audio engineering.
Electives allow students to specialize in areas like music entrepreneurship, music and technology, and the music industry's global context.
The program incorporates experational learning through internships and projects, providing students with practical experience in the music industry.
learningOutcomes: Understand the structure and functions of the music industry.
Develop skills in music production, recording, and technology.
Apply knowledge of music business law, marketing, and management.
Analyze the commercial and artistic aspects of the music industry.
Demonstrate the ability to work collaboratively in music industry contexts.
Evaluate the impact of technology on the music industry.
additionalInformation: Students are encouraged to participate in internships and projects to gain practical experience in the music industry.
